conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into.
The baffles are designed to redirect the flow of the liquid, and the direction of the liquid flow can be inferred from the orientation of the baffles.
Baffle A is horizontal and points to the right.
Baffle B is vertical and points down.
Baffle C is diagonal and points to the right.
Baffle D is horizontal and points to the right.

premise: Baffle A is horizontal and points to the right.
conclusion: The liquid will flow to the right from Baffle A.

premise: Baffle B is vertical and points down.
conclusion: The liquid will flow down from Baffle B.

premise: Baffle C is diagonal and points to the right.
conclusion: The liquid will flow to the right from Baffle C.

premise: Baffle D is horizontal and points to the right.
conclusion: The liquid will flow to the right from Baffle D.

premise: The liquid starting from A will flow to the right.
conclusion: The liquid from A will flow to the right.

premise: The liquid starting from B will flow down.
conclusion: The liquid from B will flow down.

premise: The liquid starting from C will flow to the right.
conclusion: The liquid from C will flow to the right.

premise: The liquid starting from D will flow to the right.
conclusion: The liquid from D will flow to the right.

premise: The liquid flowing to the right from A, C, and D will eventually reach container E.
conclusion: The liquid from A, C, and D will flow into container E.

premise: The liquid flowing down from B will not reach either E or F directly but will be redirected by the baffles in the lower part of the image.
conclusion: The liquid from B will flow into container F.

premise: The liquid will flow into container E from A, C, and D.
conclusion: The liquid will flow into container E from A, C, and D.

premise: The liquid will flow into container F from B.
conclusion: The liquid will flow into container F from B.
